alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Crawford, southern Washington and east central Sequoyah Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 318 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Strickler to near Natural Dam to 5 miles northeast of Roland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Van Buren... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Roland... Elkins... West Fork... Mulberry... Greenland... Dyer... Winslow... Chester... Rudy... Blackburn... Lee Creek... Devils Den State Park... Brentwood... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 323 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
